answerText: Ernst Mach[10] Another scientist-philosopher was this developer of integral calculus, who wrote Mondaology and Theodicy. He maintained we "lived in the best of all possible worlds."
heading: Illinois Fall Touranment |2012 | 5 | 15 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This man's namesake society was founded by Moritz Schlick, Rudolph Carnap and others who championed logical positivism. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this physicist who formulated a rather vague hypothesis about inertia, which states that the inertia of an object is only well-defined with respect to the rest of the objects in the universe.
